dt: {bc}an act of {a_link|restoring} or a condition of being {a_link|restored}: such as
{bc}a {a_link|restoration} of something to its rightful owner
{bc}a making good of or giving an equivalent for some injury
{bc}a legal action serving to cause restoration of a previous state

et: Middle English {it}restitucioun{/it}, from Anglo-French, from Latin {it}restitution-, restitutio{/it}, from {it}restituere{/it} to restore, from {it}re-{/it} + {it}statuere{/it} to set up {ma}{mat|statute|}{/ma}
shortdef: an act of restoring or a condition of being restored: such as
a restoration of something to its rightful owner
a making good of or giving an equivalent for some injury
